hedline.hl1: Making the Most of Beer, on Film

block.p: American history seen through a beer mug is the subject of a new film, ''The American Brew,'' produced by Florentine Films-Sherman Pictures. It begins in colonial days, when beer was safer to drink than water. It highlights the heyday of German immigration 100 or so years ago and the subsequent rise of industrialized beer plants in Milwaukee and other cities, and continues to the current craft-brewing movement. The film is enlivened by old advertising images like those above, below and left.
